body.p: There are several ways to control how the Tags Display Mode behaves in . This topic covers server defaults and persistence, a URL parameter/loading option, UI controls, and a workspace API that applies to all editors.

section.title: Server Defaults and Persistence (options.xml)
section.p: Use the following options in the options.xml configuration file to control the default rendering of tags and how a change persists:

dd.p: The default display mode for rendering XML tags in Author mode. Users can override this setting from the UI or via integration options. Allowed values:
Controls how a user-selected tags mode persists:

ul.li: perEditor - Resets to the default value whenever a new editor is opened.
perUser - The userâ€™s selection is propagated to all open editors and becomes the default for newly opened editors.

section.p: For more details about configuring options, see and the list of supported server options.

section.title: URL Parameter and Loading Option
section.p: You can set the tags mode per document using the tags-mode URL parameter or by providing a loading option before the editor opens. Supported values: full-tags-with-attributes, full-tags, block-tags, inline-tags, partial-tags, no-tags.
For an introduction to loading options, see .

section.title: User Interface Controls
section.p: Users can choose the tags mode from two places in the UI:

ul.li: The Tags Display Mode drop-down in the editor breadcrumb.

section.note: For optimal performance while keeping some tag information visible, the Partial Tags mode is recommended.
